text: The atmosphere when we came was terrible. It was like 3:30 pm and there was no one there except a table of really drunk and loud men.  The menus  we got were wet with God knows what. Smelled like beer. We walked out right away.
Best popusas ever..especially their special on Wednesday's they have their $1 popusas if you buy a dozen okay let me tell you they have the best that I ever tasted.

To me service is everything even if the food isn't so great the experience is what makes or breaks it. The food here is pretty decent but the service could be way better the girls always seem to have an attitude. probably won't go here anymore.

Really good food. Had a couple Papusas and some of the sausages. I completely enjoyed the meal. To bad that the atmosphere was ruined by one of the clients that was drunk patron who was looking for a fight. The staff kept serving the guy and allowing him to talk down to patrons. The abuse didn't stop until he began to abuse the staff.

I honestly love there pupusas here there are made fresh and very well made not like placeses where u see the fillings are in the middle and all edges are mazza there are very delishes...they also have a special on wensdays where u buy 12 or more and there $1 dollar each  and they are made well not because there cheaper they add less no not here i highly recomend this place i absolutely love it here:)

Salvadorian food place ? You got to be kidding me ! Service is mediocre and food to say the least leaves a true Salvadorian in shame I'm sure if you've never had good Salvadorian you wouldn't know the difference of course! The competition is big when it comes to restaurants step up your game and get a new cook! Nothing i ordered was even close to being good or ok

Very poor taste. The food is just not delicious. I got cheese papusas which are hard to mess up and they were weird tasting had some small pieces of something inside other than cheese - pepper or tomato or something red and green looking. I like my cheese papusas with CHEESE, no weird green and red looking surprises.

The beef dish I ordered was also not great- short rib, chewy and salty. Threw it away.

I was really not familiar with Salvadorian food when I first tried this place. The pupusas were good. I really do not have anything to base my rating on but it is very tasty and crispy. The tamales are excellent at this place (chicken or pork). The masa that they use is really fluffy and tasty. Not dry like other tamales tend to be. The menu looks really different and I want to try some of the entrees but I am afraid of being disappointed. The service is ok. Sometimes it takes them long because I believe everthing it is made to order. Order the tamales and you cannot go wrong!!!

I'm definitely a new fan! We ordered a variety of pupusas for office lunch - chicken, pork, cheese, and revuelta (combination). All of them were amazing and all except the chicken were only $1. We are a fat and happy staff this afternoon. 

We ordered to go, were told 20 minutes. The food was not only ready, but still hot and the large order was correct. They gave us plenty of slaw and sauce for the amount of food we got. 

Only a couple negatives 1: The sauce had no spicy-ness at all (maybe the girls only brought a mild version) and 2: They wanted to charge us $1.50 for plates and forks. With the amount of food we bought, utensils should have been included. 

Overall, a good experience and we will be ordering again.

A buddy of mine kept telling me about their pupusas so we came here. 

The place is kind of hidden inside a shopping center on Tropicana and Pecos. It's kind of small in size but authentic. It's pretty colorful with paintings on the wall as well as specials they have going on. I'm not familiar at all with Salvadorian food but when I walked in it smelt very good. My curiosity took over and I started to glance at what other customers were eating, everything looked fresh and good. 

This place is heavily Spanish spoken. I can read Spanish well but have still have difficulty understanding spoken words. My ordering skills could definitely improve so I let my friend handle the questions I had, just a note. 

I started out with 2 asada pupusas. Prior to serving the they set the toppings out, which are is a slaw like topping and hot sauce. We waited about 20 minutes for our food but when it came out it was hot. The pupusas had a little char from and the meat was pretty good inside. I made my meal with all the toppings and it was definitely good! 

The service was a little spotty but nothing major.

Place is ok. its cheap, food is average; i had better pupusas, service is below average and dont ask for curtido or salsa because you will not get any more even is less what you get for the food. Overall, below average.

I was a bit skeptical about eating here based on it's location and how the restaurant looks, but boy was I wrong.  I had the best carne asada I've ever had. It was tender and seasoned to perfection.  The best part is the fat tortillas.
My kinda dive! The pupusas were delicious and two of us ate lunch for $10! Recommended!
Awesome food! Kareoke on the weekends! Cheap and delicious pupusas. I liked the horchata and the chilaquiles too.

Very slow service. I was the only customer in there at 2pm on a Saturday and they never refilled my drink, or ask if I needed anything after my food was served. I saw 2 waitress and what appeared to be the manager, still my drink was never refilled. Like I said, I was the only customer in the restaurant and I received horrible service. The food was decent.

This was my 3rd visit here. I came here for the pupusas.  Usually when I know I want pupusas I order ahead of time(from here or any other salvadorian spot). Usually like 10 min before. 
Service is good. The waitresses are friendly. The food is good. I definitely recommend this place to anyone near by lookin for good Salvadorian food.

Have to give these guys a five. Came to Vegas for EDC weekend(we're from San Francisco originally) so we've got a taste for pupusas. I've eaten at probably a dozen pupuserias in San Francisco and this place really takes the cake. I love their bean and cheese and chicharron and cheese pupusas.  A cheap, tasty meal for those on a budget in Vegas.

Una gran decepción ordene 12 pupusas de queso y chicharrón y fueron las pupusas más sin sabor,  no tenían nada de chicharrón nada de queso el curtido no tiene nada de sabor y la salsa horrible mis hijos comentaron que fue un plato de tristeza es mi opinión y la de mis hijos,  respeto las demás opiniones,  El derecho ajeno es la paz. Nunca más volverémos
One of the closest to authentic salvadorean food I have tried. The place is small but the service is great so is the food very well worth the price.

This is a great hole-in-the-wall place that serves great authentic Salvadoran food, like pupusas. I'm giving it 5 stars not because it's worthy of Michelin Star... but because it's a great authentic place with amazing prices. There's a critical audience of Salvadoran people eating there. I recommend you get a Michelada with your meal.

This place is fantastic. The food is delicious and the service was wonderful. I have been staying on the strip for a few days where all the food is expensive and mediocre. On our way back to phoenix we found this little gem by chance. I looked at the other reviews and decided to stop in anyways since yelp is almost never a good way to decide on a restaurant. 

Con ganas amigos!! Muy buena comida y papusas!

My wife was craving some papusas so we drove across town to check this spot out. The place was completely empty... And it appears for good reason.  The place is dirty, run down, and falling apart. The decoration looks thrown together and random.  My wife said it was "real salvadoran" and there was a Chicken fast food bag from El Salvador which made it authentic. I guess if i ever go to El Salvador and there's a bag of KFC In an American restaurant I'll know it's a good spot.  Either way, the service was pretty bad and the cashier/waitress rolled her eyes at us. The waitress didn't speak English so my salvadoran wife had to order.  It took about 30 minutes for them to make our food.  The waitress didn't say a word to us the entire time.  She stayed in the Back the whole time.  When we got home and actually tried the food it was decent. The papusas are a little on the thick side from all the masa and the carne asada papusas have very little meat.  I'd recommend the pork and cheese and the bean and cheese.  This place would have to be the all out last resort for salvadoran food in this city.  It's not bad. . But the service and restaurant it self is not up to par with what else is in this city.
Bomb ass ceviche and revuelta pupusas than most restaurants! , for me atleast .... service is alright but definitely one of me and moms fav spot
Disgusting place. Dirty and smelly. The service is commensurate. I thought I'd give them a chance and try the food... Worst mistake ever.

REMEMBER: ALWAYS WATCH WHAT YOUR KIDS ARE EATING!!!! 
First of all, we came here with my family who were visiting from California. This place couldn't have left a worst impression on my family, I feel so embarrassed. Anyway, some of us ordered a salvadorian breakfast that included avocado, when we were ordering I said "I want the one that includes avocado"... They bring me and my other two family members our plate with no avocado instead they put a small piece of bland cheese. I ask the lady "Didn't this plate include avocado?" and she says "oh sorry we're out of avocado" like wait? Aren't they suppose to tell you when they're out of something once your order and if not come back and tell me if it's okay that it doesn't bring something that the menu says it brings. I mean come on, that's something they do at every other restaurant. SECONDLY, THE WORST OF THE WORST! I cannot begin to tell you how gross and disgusting this was... my little brother decided to order chicken strips off the kid's menu AND THEY WERE ALL COMPLETELY AND ENTIRELY RAW!!!!!!!!!!!!! 
And nobody noticed until he had eaten half of them!!!! Come on!! My little brother could've had a bad bad food poisining or something way worst!!! Thank God it was no more than bad stomachache and horrible gut feeling of your little brother eating raw chicken! 
On top of that they still decided to charge us for the nasty chicken strip plate! Even McDonald's would offer a free meal if anything close to that were to happen. 
NEVER COMING BACK!!!! 
P.S there's a picture of the raw chicken strip**********

If I can zero stars I would. My husband and I called early and when we came to pay and pick up they got the order wrong. I wouldn't get upset for that but when the cashier said to my husband that he by force had to pay and take the food he did not order! Acting like he said it wrong on purpose and got offended. The order was for more than 20 people and gave us not even for 1/3 of them. I would normally go there but this time I can't believe how the cashier treated us.

I wanted to go to the taco place next door but my partner really wanted a pupusa. He lamented that this establishment was the first place he had ever tried a pupusa and had fond memories of it. Up for anything, I agreed (after some arm twisting).

Well. What can I say, this place is a total dive. Looked old and worn. Not very inviting, but seemed authentic strangely enough. We sat at a table by the cash register. The waitress didn't speak much English and I wasn't confident in her knowledge of what type of flour they used for the pupusas.

At any rate, we got a mix of chicken, zucchini, shrimp, and a rice pupusa, along with one horchata. The horchata came out first. It was.... not what we expected. There was an unfamiliar taste in it, the waitress said it was zucchini seeds. I don't know much about traditional horchata, but uhh ok. Zucchini seeds.

The pupusas came out with some curtido. The pupusas themselves were nice and hot, but on the oily side and could have used a lot more salt. Lot lot more. Fillings seemed a little sparse.

The waitress was no where to be seen after she dropped the food off. We had to get up and flag someone down in the kitchen to get our bill and some to go boxes.

Not somewhere I would go again. Tacos next time.

This place was okay. Service as well but only because the lady helping us was actually nice other than that it was horrible by the owner. I didn't feel like it was authentic Salvi food, it reminded me of when you go to a salvi and Mexican restaurant and the cooks are Mexican trying to cook salvi food. A lot of food didn't have flavor or wasn't prepared how it normally would be. I assume everyone does it different but wasn't all that good, I won't come again. Especially that the owner was a huge bitch. My husband asked how much they charged him for something and she replied "go look at the menu all the prices are there, why are you asking." She was lucky I wasn't there and I was washing my hands.
This restauran have best pupusas I ever tray here in vegas I recommend this place and really good prices

Very cheap and very good. Tamales were $1.75. Pupusas was $1.60. Pupusas were the best I have had. Very authentic place. I love how the tamales have a hidden french fry potato  inside with one green olive. :)
These are honestly the best pupusas in Las Vegas. I have never ate anything else, just pupusas. Very good and full of filling. Their red salsa and curtido are delicious too.
